item.title: Report X-2024080135
item.description:
Report X-2024080135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-06T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-01
  • City: HOLBROOK
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The box was found wet on the trailer in the am sort. The package handler called over an admin who brought over a red plastic hazmat bucket, a hazmat bag and gloves. The admin put the bag inside the bucket and used the gloves to put the box inside the hazmat bin. the box was not actively leaking. The box was just wet. Upon inspection saw the cap on the one plastic 5 L container was loose and it looked like 4 oz of liquid could have leaked out of the plastic container into the box. There was no liquid on the floor of the trailer.

item.title: Report X-2024080035
item.description:
Report X-2024080035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-05T15:15:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-26
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY THE SWEEPER IN SECTION-C AT DOOR 27. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 2 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WAS MINISCULE PUNCTURE HOLE AT THE BASE CORNER ON A CLOSED HEAD, POLY, 5-GAL PAIL, CAUSING APPROX. 14 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CONTAINER WAS A SINGLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ IN BURSTING TEST.

  • Description: 1. X-2024072191 The package was found damaged by the venting of the closure allowing the tablet powder inside to seep out and damage the box. The package has a oxidizer sticker. 2. X-2024072192 The package was damaged when the cleaning product seeped out of the lid onto the box. The package had no paperwork to match the oxidizer sticker. 3. X-2024072193 The package was found torn and upon inspection, it was found that the product vented allowing the cleaner to damage the box. 4. X-2024072195 The package was found torn by the vented cleaning product inside. the closure seeped allowing the powder tablets inside to tear through the box. 5. X-2024072196 The package was found torn by the cleaning product inside and upon inspection the package seems to be a undeclared hazmat. 6. X-2024072213 attachment Name:thumbnail_IMG_5964.jpg

item.description:
Report X-2024072393

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: MESQUITE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Preload thought the package was damaged and 99'd it on the 25th. I did not see it until the 26th and upon inspection I determined it wasn't damaged beyond the outer box having been splashed by something. The actual item inside was perfectly fine, I tested it and even had it sit out for a few hours to see if it leaked. Once I determined it wasn't damaged, I reboxed it and wrapped it in bubble wrap and spill pads, then set it out to be put on the vans by Preload. When I came in today I found it back at the hazmat cage with a puncture in the bottom of the bottle.

item.title: Report X-2024072457
item.description:
Report X-2024072457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE BY AN UNLOADER IN SECTION-C. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PACKAGE, HE EVACUATED THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 1 MINUTE A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 POLY, 1-GAL JUGS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APPROXIMATELY 12 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID PRODUCT TO SPILL THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND SECONDARY CONTAINMENT CONSISTED OF A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 51 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.description:
Report X-2024072474

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-25
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A CALL WAS MADE TO THE PSC STATING THERE WAS A HAZMAT IN THE TOP BIN THAT WAS LEAKED ON OR LEAKING. RESPONDER DONNED PPE BRINGING THE DECISION TREE. WHEN SHE SAW THE PACKAGE, SHE KNEW IT WAS LEAKING. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, SHE BEGAN THE PROCESS TO CONTAIN THE BOX IN A SPILL TUB AND ALL THE SUBSEQUENT AFFECTED PACKAGES. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE ACTION STEPS AND REMOVED ALL AFFECTED ITEMS AND DECONTAMINATED THE BINS. THE PACKAGES WERE TAKEN TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING AND FINAL DISPOSITION ACCORDING TO PROCEDURE.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: MC ALLEN
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PM CLERK FOUND LEAKING STEEL DRUM AMONG CLERICAL PACKAGES AND CALLED PM HAZMAT RESPONDER, WHO DONNED PPE, TOOK A SPILL CART AND RESPONDED TO THE INCIDENT. STEEL DRUM WAS LEAKING VERY SLOWLY (DROP BY DROP), SO THE SPILL WAS MINIMAL. STEEL DRUM WAS TAKEN TO DMP, AND ONCE THE LEAK WAS DETERMINED TO BE COMING FROM THE BOTTOM SEAL OF THE DRUM AND THAT IT THEREFORE COULDN'T BE KEPT FROM LEAKING FURTHER, THE ENTIRE CONTENTS WERE SOLIDIFIED WITH ZEP SORBENT AND GREEN-BAGGED.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/21/2024 at approximately 1733, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 926763 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a printing ink spill. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing 4-1 gallon plastic jugs. The shipment under the tracking number ending in -9348, was reportedly mishandled, resulting in spillage. The ink from the spill soaked into the labels, destroying all of the pertinent package information. The damaged pacakge was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held for the FAA.

  • Description: On 7/21/2024 at approximately 1100, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 8 metal cans, each individually overpacked in a fiberboard box, and then all were overpacked onto a pallet. One the packages was reportedly damaged due to mishandling, resulting in spillage. The damaged package was placed in a salvage drum and the entire shipment is being held, awating an amended shipper's declaration to be returned to the shipper.

  • Description: On July 18, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1791 was punctured by a skid and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a neutralizing agent to remediate the UN1791-impacted loading dock floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Description: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND LEAKING. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 1 LITER LEAKED OUT DUE TO THE LIDS/CLOSURES BEING CRUSHED AND LOOSE. AWAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW.

item.description:
Report X-2024072251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A SIMILAR GROUND PACKAGE CAME THROUGH AT THE SAME TIME AND WAS FOUND WITH UNDECLARED CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THIS AIR PACKAGE, WE FOUND 20 X 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE QUICK CURE MULTI-PURPOSE FOAM SEALANT INSIDE THE BOX. THERE IS A POUCH AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX WITH A PACKING SLIP THAT INDICATES LTD QTY HAZMAT, CLASS 2.2, UN1956. THOSE INDICATORS WERE NOT VISIBLE AT THE TIME OF INSPECTION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/10/2024 at approximately 0730, Dangerous Good Administration received notification of a dangerous goods spill at the station location in Hampton from Employee 4346935. The shipment consisted of 4 fiberboard boxes, each containing one fire extinguisher. One of the package which shipped under the tracking number ending in -1105, appeared to have been mishandled and showed evidence of spillage. Further inspection revealed the extiguisher inside of the mishandled package had accidentally discharged inside of the outer package. The spilled package was placed in a salvage drum and set for disposal and the remaining pieces of the shipment are being held, pending the receipt of an amended shipper's declaration from the shipper.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-03
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LDA experienced a UN3469, Klean Strip Premium Stripper release from (7) 1-gallon metal cans. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the boxes the cans were in and estimated that 0.5-gallons of material was released due to being crushed because of improper loading. The release impacted the cardboard packaging and pallet on the trailer. The damaged cans were placed into a55-gallon poly drum along with damaged and impacted cardboard. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND THAT THE CLOSURES WERE RIPPED OPEN AS WELL. THE MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO A YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM IN SAFE AND TIMELY MANNER. APPROXIMATELY 10 LITERS LEAKED OUT DUE TO ALL 4 CAPS BEING LOOSE AND ALSO 2 CAPS HAD A TINY HOLES IN EACH OF THEM. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION NOW FROM PGH.

TWO ADDITIONAL JUGS, TOTALING FOUR 5L JUGS, WERE PACKED INSIDE OF SEPERATE INTERNAL BOX WAS ALSO WET BUT CAPS WERE NOT LOOSE ON THOSE TWO JUGS.

item.description:
Report X-2024071603

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T21:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: RICHFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found at door 125 in the load end ready to go to the next load point. The outbound sort manager walked passed it and noticed a very strong odor coming from the box. QA was contacted immediately to inspect the box. I noticed a little wet spot on one of the bottom corners of the package and brought it over to the office in a lined tote for further inspection. The inner drum seamed to have a poor quality closure that caused some of the contents to spill out and make it a little noticeable to the naked eye. Once the package was fully opened, the corrugated liner seamed to be wet also to confirm that the hazmat was damaged and could have possibly been damaged while it was on the vehicle when the driver returned from the pick up but could have dried do to the Acetone & Isopropyl Alcohol ingredient that makes up the product.

  • City: BAY SHORE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO- XIY contacted ERTS regarding leaking 1-gallon bottles of Muriatic Acid. It is apparent that the leaking bottles may have had loose fitting caps and therefore improper packaging is the cause of the release. Approximately, 2-liters of product spilled onto the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area. A Contractor contained the release using oil dry and neutralized the product using sodium bicarbonate. One drum of waste was generated for the overpacked and neutralized muriatic acid and one empty drum that last contained the leaking product until a Contractor could dispatch was generated, as well. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HEPACO was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 4ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that four (4) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging four (4) plastic jugs. HEPACO personnel moved all the boxes from the pallet to verify only four (4) jugs were damaged, deployed absorbents, and then swept up the released material. The damaged boxes, jugs and recovered material were placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums and was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported to ERTS that 2-55 gallon poly drums of UN3214 Carusol Liquid Permanganate were found leaking on the dock due to faulty packaging from the shipper. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 1ft-by-1ft area of the pallet and estimated that seven (7) ounces of material were released from four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. Clean Harbors personnel overpacked the leaking drums into four (4) 95-gallon poly drums and containerized the pallet and spent PPE into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum for disposal.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-31T18:16:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-09
  • City: Saddle Brook
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1025
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At approximately 22 : 11 a package containing an undelcared 6000Wh lithium ion battery, with terminals unprotected, was placed on the metal grating outside of door 102. Moments later, the package started emitting smoke and plant engineering was notified. The package caught on fire and employees evacuated the building as the fire department was called. A mechanic and his supervisor attempted to extinguish the fire but it kept reigniting. The fire department arrived, pulled the package outside, and extinguished it. At 22:58. the fire department gave the 'all cleaT to return to the building.
